channel.title: Retail Arbitrage RA - Amazing FBA - Grow your 7-Figure Amazon Business

image.title: Retail Arbitrage RA - Amazing FBA - Grow your 7-Figure Amazon Business

channel.itunes:summary:
Do you sell private label or custom products on Amazon UK, USA or Europe? Or are you gearing up to do it?

If you are struggling to grow sales, seeing profits erode and feel a long way from a sellable valuable business, we can help. If you're already killing it, why not grow faster and make even more cash?
Either way, you're in the right place.

Our experts answer these questions and more - experts like Greg Mercer of Jungle Scout, Will Tjernlund, Manuel Becvar, Chris Green, Kevin King, and many many more.

Whether you are trying to get Amazon product research right; help sourcing from China; optimizing Amazon listings; dealing with Amazon PPC (aka Amazon ads) - we've got you covered!

If you're UK based and you want to sell in UK or USA; and if you're US based and you're curious about - or selling in - UK or Europe, you can't afford to miss the detailed insights you'll get.
channel.itunes:author: Michael Veazey
channel.itunes:subtitle: Amazing FBA Amazon and ECommerce Podcast, for Amazon Private Label Sellers, Shopify, Magento or Woocommerce business owners, and other e-commerce sellers and digital entrepreneurs.

image.title: Retail Arbitrage RA - Amazing FBA - Grow your 7-Figure Amazon Business

item.title: Amazon Stock Management with Eva.Guru
item.dc:creator: Von Leong
item.description:
Today Hai Mag, the CEO and cofounder of Eva will talk about how to do proper stock management with Eva. Eva is an “intelligent profit maximization platform for Amazon sellers”. Amazon stock management, also known as Amazon inventory management, is not a sexy topic.  The sugar high of instant sales from advertising is more alluring. […]

The post Amazon Stock Management with Eva.Guru appeared first on Amazing FBA - Grow your 7-Figure Amazon Business.
item.itunes:subtitle: Today Hai Mag, the CEO and cofounder of Eva will talk about how to do proper stock management with Eva. Eva is an “intelligent profit maximization platform for Amazon sellers”. Amazon stock management, also known as Amazon inventory management,
item.itunes:summary:
Today Hai Mag, the CEO and cofounder of Eva will talk about how to do proper stock management with Eva. Eva is an “intelligent profit maximization platform for Amazon sellers”. Amazon stock management, also known as Amazon inventory management, is not a sexy topic.  The sugar high of instant sales from advertising is more alluring.

But great Amazon inventory management is absolutely central to making sustainable profits. And having sustained cash flow. Get it right and you've got a key element of a money-making machine.



A lot of sellers limit themselves by not using the right tools for Amazon stock management. Above all, they have bits of information in different places. The most important thing for more established sellers is to create an integrated stock management system. 


 

Amazon Stock management needs to be automated

 


If you're a seller with high numbers of SKUs to manage, you need to automate Amazon stock management. If you don't do it, you face several poor outcomes.


 


First of all, you will  be missing out on $100,000s of lost sales if you go out of stock. Secondly, you're tying up cash - and increasing your working capital needs by $100,000s - if you have way too much stock. And thirdly, you are wasting a lot of management time on inventory management. Time you should be spending to grow your business.


 

Integrating 3PLs into Amazon stock management

 


Hai and his team have been creating "smart" 3PL warehouses. That means they have connected their warehouses to a central system that manages stock and demand. Meaning that the 3PLs automatically know when inventory needs to be pushed from the warehouse into FBA fulfilment centres. And they do this without the business operator having to make manual decisions. Or communicate manually.


 


Get a 15 day free trial of Eva's system here.


 

Good inventory management includes repricing and Amazon ads strategy

 


Just as importantly, a good stock management system must account for other factors. If you operate stock management in a vacuum, you risk being overstocked or out of stock. One critical factor is pricing. Having a sophisticated dynamic repricer is powerful. But integrating that with amazon seller central inventory management  is much more powerful. Add in 3PLs feeding stock into Amazon and you have a powerful system for maximising profit.


 


If you're running Amazon ads, it's also vital to integrate Amazon ad strategy with stock control. If you don't, you'll be spending money to drive yourself out of stock! Which in turn will crater your sales and your profits AND your cash flow!


 


In short, the only way to go is to use an integrated inventory management system. Integrate pricing, stock management and Amazon ads and you're most of the way there. Add in intelligent and automated 3PLs feeding stock into FBA...and you've created a real profit-making machine!


You'll Learn:

* The classic errors of stock management
item.itunes:author: Michael Veazey
item.itunes:title: Amazon Stock Management with Eva.Guru

item.title: Sell Your Products to Retailers with Paul Brooks of Retail Outside In
item.dc:creator: Von Leong
item.description:
If the  lockdown  hit retail everywhere in the world in 2020 and 2021 is big news, there is another interesting trend happening more quietly in ecommerce. TO put it simply: despite the massive growth in Amazon sales – or possibly because of it – ecommerce sellers now have more to lose than ever before from […]

The post Sell Your Products to Retailers with Paul Brooks of Retail Outside In appeared first on Amazing FBA - Grow your 7-Figure Amazon Business.
item.itunes:subtitle: If the lockdown hit retail everywhere in the world in 2020 and 2021 is big news, there is another interesting trend happening more quietly in ecommerce. TO put it simply: despite the massive growth in Amazon sales - or possibly because of it - ecomme...
item.itunes:summary:
If the  lockdown  hit retail everywhere in the world in 2020 and 2021 is big news, there is another interesting trend happening more quietly in ecommerce. TO put it simply: despite the massive growth in Amazon sales - or possibly because of it - ecommerce sellers now have more to lose than ever before from Amazon account suspensions. And they are getting ever more frustrated with the lack of customer data from Amazon. 

The natural next step is to set up your own Shopify or Direct to Consumer (DTC) site. But what if there are other options that could move as many units - or possibly many more - and bring big profits?


Step forward the B2B business to business model of selling your products to retailers, most of whom will have a physical store or network of physical retail locations. While not common and not as easy to start as the classic Shopify move, this has many upsides for someone with good product development abilities and or a great product.  Today’s guest, Paul Brooks, explores with Michael what the upsides are of this approach; and how to start approaching retailers successfully.

 
You'll Learn:

* If Brick and Mortar have a future and what it will look like
* Why we still need B&M and not just online stores
* How to sell B&M to retailers
* The attractive qualities of B&M
* Comparing online and offline buyer experience
* How to drive a person to discover that product
* Physical Retailer vs Product Developer
* How social media drives traffic
* How to sell experience in a physical store
item.itunes:author: Michael Veazey
item.itunes:title: Sell Your Products to Retailers with Paul Brooks of Retail Outside In

item.title: Amazon Product Development with Mina Elias of MMA Nutrition
item.dc:creator: Von Leong
item.description:
Custom Product Development is one of the biggest and hardest jobs in e-Commerce. Often the focus among Amazon Private Label/custom product sellers is on hacks to the selling side of your business. While those are important, if you don’t have a product that solves your customers’ problems better than the competition, it’s going to be […]

The post Amazon Product Development with Mina Elias of MMA Nutrition appeared first on Amazing FBA - Grow your 7-Figure Amazon Business.
item.itunes:subtitle: Custom Product Development is one of the biggest and hardest jobs in e-Commerce. Often the focus among Amazon Private Label/custom product sellers is on hacks to the selling side of your business. While those are important,
item.itunes:summary:
Custom Product Development is one of the biggest and hardest jobs in e-Commerce. Often the focus among Amazon Private Label/custom product sellers is on hacks to the selling side of your business.
While those are important, if you don't have a product that solves your customers' problems better than the competition, it's going to be very hard to have even medium term success. In the end, if your customers love the results of your product, they will reward you with good reviews. In turn, this gives great conversion rates and keeps your units selling, your cash flowing and your profits growing.
Mina Elias is the Chief Executive Officer at MMA Nutrition and is a living example of how customer and results obsession drives product development for raving fan customers on Amazon.
Find out how Mina who was obsessed with nutrition, turned his MMA career into a successful Amazon business.
 

To find out more about Mina Elias' PPC Agency click here.

If you want to check out some PPC training, click here.

 
You'll Learn:

* To simplify your product
* How Mina created his first supplement and how it impacted his business
* What Mina had to create to solve his nutritional need
* How to do product development
* Identify a problem and try to create a product to solve that issue
* How to research solutions
* To look at other products and find their limitations
* How to use your strengths to your advantage
item.itunes:author: Michael Veazey
item.itunes:title: Amazon Product Development with Mina Elias of MMA Nutrition

Edmund Zagorin is the founder of Bid Ops, which is a “predictive procurement platform” that helps businesses drive 2-5X savings in their product sourcing they do that by getting better quotes faster. With Fortune 100 customers and impressive case studies, Bid Ops is changing the way business teams partner with suppliers. 

 
You'll Learn:

* Why traditional procurement is broken
* The three different solutions to get around the shortage of labor
* To understand whether a price is competitive enough to prove
* That tasks that are easier to do get moved to the front of the line
* Tips from a Strategic sourcing consultant
* How reverse actions helped model his AI simulator
* What  procurement wants
* When you can really expect to save money
* The practical outcomes in the predictive procurement platform
